title: 109_hr377
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005". Death gratuity enhancements are included in the Act. The "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005" includes enhancements to the death gratuity, increasing it to $100,000 for deaths resulting from combat-related causes or causes incurred in designated operations or areas. The HEROES Act of 2005 enhances the death gratuity to $100,000 for combat-related deaths. Subsection (d) is amended to include death gratuities under subsections (a) and (c). Additional gratuity is required for deaths before the effective date. The HEROES Act of 2005 increases the death gratuity to $238,000 for members of the Armed Forces who died as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in specific operations. Beneficiaries entitled to the regular military death gratuity will also receive the additional death gratuity. The additional death gratuity is payable to beneficiaries entitled to the regular military death gratuity. The amount payable to each beneficiary is determined based on the ratio of their share of the regular military death gratuity to the total amount payable to all beneficiaries. Definitions for "additional death gratuity" and "regular military death gratuity" are provided in this subsection. SEC. 3. SERVICEMEMBERS' GROUP LIFE INSURANCE ENHANCEMENTS. Increased Maximum Amount Under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 and additional amount for members serving in certain areas or operations. Increased amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 with an additional $150,000 for members serving in designated combat operations or zones. The amount of insurance for a member under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is limited to $400,000. If a member elects an amount exceeding $250,000, the insurance will be reduced to comply with the $400,000 limit. During designated combat operations, $150,000 of insurance coverage costs will be covered and not deducted from the member's pay. The Secretary determines the cost of Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance traceable to section 1967, with a limit of $150,000 covered during combat operations. Section 1967(a)(2)(A) is amended to exclude insurance provided under paragraph (3)(A)(i)(III). Section 1977(a) is amended to increase the limit to $400,000 and clarify that additional insurance under section 1967(e) does not affect Veterans' Group Life Insurance issuance. In section 1967(a), amendments require notice to spouse for member's insurance election and written consent for spouse for insurance amount. Section 1970 is amended for redesignation of beneficiaries. Section 1970 is amended to require written consent from a member's spouse before modifying beneficiaries. The effective date for this section and its amendments is more than 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
